Chico CONCHITO, Appellant,
v.

Court of Criminal Appeals of Oklahoma.

James O. Goodwin, Tulsa, for appellant.

*1385 OPINION
BRETT, Judge:
The appellant, Chico Conchito, hereinafter referred to as defendant, was charged, tried and convicted in the Municipal Court, City of Tulsa, Tulsa County, in Case No. 153732 for the crime of Using Profane and Obscene Language Which Insulted and Offended a Person, in violation of Title 27, Section 122, of the Tulsa Revised Ordinances. *1386 He was sentenced to pay a fine of One Hundred Fifty ($150.00) Dollars and to serve a term of Ninety (90) days in the city jail, after a trial before the judge, said sentence being suspended. A timely appeal has been perfected to this Court.
This appeal draws into question the facial constitutionality of Section 122, of the Tulsa Revised Ordinances which provides:
"It shall be an offense for any person to use or utter any profane or obscene language or proposal when any person hearing such is insulted or offended thereby, regardless to whom such is directed."
